comments.raw_text:
Steps to reproduce:
 1) Run Firefox using a profile that has not seen a telemetry-capable Firefox before.

Actual results:
The infobar that shows up has "Yes" and "No" buttons requiring the users to pay close attention to how the question is phrased. Also, users might be inclined to click "No" without reading.

Expected results:
Expected the buttons to phrased like Mac's "Save" and "Don't Save": i.e. "Help" and "Don't Help".

Agreed on the use of Y/N being wrong.

"Help" is a little bit special since we have a function in the UI already called that.

The best I can come up with at this hour is "Contribute" and "Don't contribute", but a native speaker might be able to find something better here. :)
